Wisdom: الْهَوَى يُرْدِي
enWisdom: Vain desire destroys

Wisdom: طَاعَةُ الْهَوَى تُرْدِي
enWisdom: Submitting to vain desire causes ruin

Wisdom: مَنْ جَرَى مَعَ الْهَوَى عَثَرَ بِالرَّدَى
enWisdom: One who proceeds with vain desire falls into destruction

Wisdom: مَنِ اتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ أَرْدَى نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever follows his vain desire destroys himself

Wisdom: الْهَوَى قَرِينٌ مُهْلِكٌ
enWisdom: Vain desire is a pernicious associate

Wisdom: مَنْ أَطَاعَ هَوَاهُ هَلَكَ
enWisdom: Whoever yields to his vain desire is destroyed

Wisdom: مَرْكَبُ الْهَوَى مَرْكَبٌ مُرْدٍ
enWisdom: Vain desire is a riding mount that throws down its rider

Wisdom: إِذَا غَلَبَتْ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْوَاؤُكُمْ أَوْرَدَتْكُمْ مَوَارِدَ الْهَلَكَةِ
enWisdom: When your vain desires overcome you, they drag you into places of destruction

Wisdom: هَلَكَ مَنْ أَضَلَّهُ الْهَوَى وَاسْتَقَادَهُ الشَّيْطَانُ إِلَى سَبِيلِ الْعَمَى
enWisdom: Ruined is the one who is led astray by vain desire and pulled by Satan towards the path of blindness

Wisdom: هَوَاكَ أَعْدَى عَلَيْكَ مِنْ كُلِّ عَدُوٍّ فَاغْلِبْهُ وَإِلَّا أَهْلَكَكَ
enWisdom: Your vain desire is a greater enemy towards you than all [other] enemies, so overpower it otherwise it will destroy you

Wisdom: لَا تَتَّبِعِ الْهَوَى فَمَنْ تَبِعَ هَوَاهُ ارْتَبَكَ
enWisdom: Do not follow [your] vain desire, for whoever follows his vain desire becomes disconcerted

Wisdom: لَا عَاجِزَ أَعْجَزُ مِمَّنْ أَهْمَلَ نَفْسَهُ فَأَهْلَكَهَا
enWisdom: There is no one more powerless than he who neglects his soul thereby destroying it

Wisdom: سَبَبُ فَسَادِ الدِّينِ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: The cause of corruption of faith is vain desire

Wisdom: مَا أَهْلَكَ الدِّينَ كَالْهَوَى
enWisdom: Nothing destroys religion like vain desire

Wisdom: لَا تُرَخِّصْ لِنَفْسِكَ فِي مُطَاوَعَةِ الْهَوَى وَإِيثَارِ لَذَّاتِ الدُّنْيَا فَيَفْسُدَ دِينُكَ وَلَا يَصْلُحَ وَتَخْسُرَ نَفْسُكَ وَلَا تَرْبَحَ
enWisdom: Do not permit yourself to submit to vain desires or to prefer the pleasures of this world such that your faith gets corrupted and cannot be reformed and your soul loses and does not gain

Wisdom: لَا دِينَ مَعَ هَوًى
enWisdom: There is no faith with vain desire

Wisdom: الْهَوَى مَطِيَّةُ الْفِتَنِ
enWisdom: Vain desire is the riding mount of temptations

Wisdom: الْهَوَى مَطِيَّةُ الْفِتْنَةِ
enWisdom: Vain desire is a riding mount of temptation

Wisdom: الْهَوَى أُسُّ الْمِحَنِ
enWisdom: Vain desire is the foundation of tribulations

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَطَاعَةَ الْهَوَى فَإِنَّهُ يَقُودُ إِلَى كُلِّ مِحْنَةٍ
enWisdom: Beware of yielding to vain desire, for indeed it leads [one] towards every [form of] tribulation

Wisdom: إِيَّاكُمْ وَتَمَكُّنَ الْهَوَى مِنْكُمْ فَإِنَّ أَوَّلَهُ فِتْنَةٌ وَآخِرَهُ مِحْنَةٌ
enWisdom: Beware of allowing vain desire to gain control over you for indeed its beginning is temptation and its end is tribulation

Wisdom: أَوَّلُ الْهَوَى فِتْنَةٌ وَآخِرُهُ مِحْنَةٌ
enWisdom: The beginning of vain desire is temptation and its end is tribulation

Wisdom: احْذَرُوا هَوًى هَوَى بِالْأَنْفُسِ هُوِيّاً وَأَبْعَدَهَا عَنْهُ [عن‏] قَرَارَةَ الْفَوْزِ قَصِيّاً
enWisdom: Be cautious of the vain desire that pulls the souls down, dropping them [to the lowest levels], and causes them to become more distanced from [the place of] success [and prosperity]

Wisdom: إِنْ لَمْ تَرْدَعْ نَفْسَكَ عَنْ كَثِيرٍ مِمَّا تُحِبُّ مَخَافَةَ مَكْرُوهِهِ سَمَتْ بِكَ الْأَهْوَاءُ إِلَى كَثِيرٍ مِنَ الضَّرَرِ
enWisdom: If you do not restrain your soul from many of the things that you love out of fear of its displeasure, then vain desires will drive you towards a lot of harm

Wisdom: إِنَّكَ إِنْ أَطَعْتَ هَوَاكَ أَصَمَّكَ وَأَعْمَاكَ وَأَفْسَدَ مُنْقَلَبَكَ وَأَرْدَاكَ
enWisdom: Verily if you follow your vain desire, it will make you deaf and blind, ruin your place of [final] return and destroy you

Wisdom: إِنَّكُمْ إِنْ أَمَّرْتُمْ عَلَيْكُمُ الْهَوَى أَصَمَّكُمْ وَأَعْمَاكُمْ وَأَرْدَاكُمْ
enWisdom: Verily if you allow vain desire rule over you, it will deafen you, blind you and destroy you

Wisdom: تَغْلِبُهُ نَفْسُهُ عَلَى مَا يَظُنُّ وَلَا يَغْلِبْهَا عَلَى مَا يَسْتَيْقِنُ قَدْ جَعَلَ هَوَاهُ أَمِيرَهُ وَأَطَاعَهُ فِي سَائِرِ أُمُورِهِ
enWisdom: He (a) said about the one whom he was censuring: His [lower] self dominates him by means of that which he assumes, and he cannot overpower it with what he is certain ofHe has made his vain desire his master and he obeys it in all his affairs

Wisdom: فِي طَاعَةِ الْهَوَى كُلُّ الْغَوَايَةِ
enWisdom: In succumbing to vain desire there is every [form of] deviation

Wisdom: قَدْ ضَلَّ مَنِ انْخَدَعَ لِدَوَاعِي الْهَوَى
enWisdom: Indeed the one who is deceived by the temptations of [his] vain desire has gone astray

Wisdom: مَنْ قَوِيَ هَوَاهُ ضَعُفَ عَزْمُهُ
enWisdom: One whose vain desire is strong, his resolve becomes weak

Wisdom: مَنْ وَافَقَ هَوَاهُ خَالَفَ رُشْدَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever agrees with his vain desire opposes his rectitude [and reason]

Wisdom: مَنْ رَكِبَ هَوَاهُ زَلَّ
enWisdom: Whoever embarks on his vain desire slips

Wisdom: مَنْ فَعَلَ مَا شَاءَ لَقِيَ مَا سَاءَ
enWisdom: One who does as he wishes meets that which displeases him

Wisdom: مَنْ رَكِبَ الْهَوَى أَدْرَكَ الْعَمَى
enWisdom: Whoever embarks on vain desire is afflicted by blindness

Wisdom: مَنْ أَطَاعَ هَوَاهُ بَاعَ آخِرَتَهُ بِدُنْيَاهُ
enWisdom: Whoever yields to his vain desire has sold his Hereafter for his worldly life

Wisdom: مَنْ خَالَفَ رُشْدَهُ تَبِعَ هَوَاهُ
enWisdom: One who opposes his reason follows his desires

Wisdom: مَنْ غَلَبَ هَوَاهُ عَلَى عَقْلِهِ ظَهَرَتْ عَلَيْهِ الْفَضَائِحُ
enWisdom: One whose vain desire overpowers his intellect is overcome by disgrace

Wisdom: مَنْ مَلَكَهُ الْهَوَى لَمْ يَقْبَلْ مِنْ نَصُوحٍ نُصْحاً
enWisdom: One who is controlled by vain desire does not accept the advice of any sincere adviser

Wisdom: مَنْ رَخَّصَ لِنَفْسِهِ ذَهَبَتْ بِهِ فِي مَذَاهِبِ الظُّلْمَةِ
enWisdom: One who leaves his [carnal] soul free [to do as it wills] will be taken by it to the paths of darkness [and evil]

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَفَادَهُ هَوَاهُ اسْتَحْوَذَ عَلَيْهِ الشَّيْطَانُ
enWisdom: Whoever is led by his vain desire, Satan prevails upon him

Wisdom: مَنْ نَظَرَ بِعَيْنِ هَوَاهُ افْتُتِنَ وَجَارَ وَعَنْ نَهْجِ السَّبِيلِ زَاغَ وَحَارَ
enWisdom: Whoever looks with the eye of his vain desire falls into temptation and wrongdoing, and deviates and turns away from the clear open path

Wisdom: مَغْلُوبُ الْهَوَى دَائِمُ الشَّقَاءِ مُؤَبَّدُ الرِّقِّ
enWisdom: The one who is overpowered by vain desire is always wretched and forever enslaved

Wisdom: نِعْمَ عَوْنُ الشَّيْطَانِ اتِّبَاعُ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: Following vain desire is indeed a good aide to Satan

Wisdom: لَا تَرْكَنُوا إِلَى جُهَّالِكُمْ وَلَا تَنْقَادُوا لِأَهْوَائِكُمْ فَإِنَّ النَّازِلَ بِهَذَا الْمَنْزِلِ عَلى‏ شَفا جُرُفٍ هارٍ
enWisdom: NULL
